item.title: The Folsom Library elevator will be out of service from May 27 to August 22 for a planned system upgrade.
item.description: The Folsom Library elevator will be out of service from May 27 to August 22 for a planned system upgrade. We apologize for any difficulty this causes. Please plan accordingly, and do not hesitate to ask at the Service Desk if you need assistance or require accommodations.

item.title: Food Drive to Support Campus food Pantry July 7th -11th
item.description: Date: Monday, July 7, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM - Celebrating the 1 year Anniversary of the opening of our on-campus Food pantry, We will be holding a week long food drive. Collecting Non perishable food items and Personal Hygiene items for the Campus Pantry. Donations can be dropped of at Off campus Commons 1525 15th street or email offcampus@rpi.edu to have items picked up.

item.title: Office Relocation Notice – Parking and Transportation Department
item.description: Dear RPI community, We would like to inform you that the Parking and Transportation department has officially moved to a new location. Effective immediately, our office can now be found at: Facilities Customer Service Center located in the Service Building on 11th Street. Our hours of operation and contact information remain the same. Phone number : 518-276-8528 or 518-276-6616 and email: parking@rpi.edu. We are committed to continuing to provide the same high level of service to the campus…

item.title: Campus Cleanout Days Scheduled this Summer
item.description: Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) and Environmental & Site Services (E&SS) are partnering with the campus community to encourage cleanouts of cluttered storage areas, offices, shops, and labs. Take advantage of these free events to prepare your spaces for the upcoming fall semester!

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia- Asara Senaratne: Graph-Based Anomaly Detection: Uncovering Hidden Signals in Complex Data | July 7
item.description:
Date: Monday, July 7, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Dr. Asara Senaratne is a Lecturer in Computer Science at Flinders University, South Australia, specializing in anomaly detection, data visualization, and knowledge representation. Her research applies AI, machine learning, and data science to enhance data quality and knowledge discovery, with a focus on anomaly detection across domains such as health, semantic web, cyberspace, and Industry 4.0.
